acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] beads-macros has AGENTS.md
- [ ] beads-core has AGENTS.md
- [ ] beads-api has AGENTS.md
- [ ] beads-surface has AGENTS.md
- [ ] Each documents boundary, deps, and verification
description:
**Problem**
New crates (beads-macros, beads-core, beads-api, beads-surface) need AGENTS.md files documenting their boundaries, following the pattern established in existing crate directories.

**Files to create**
- `crates/beads-macros/AGENTS.md`
- `crates/beads-core/src/AGENTS.md` (can be moved from beads-rs/src/core/AGENTS.md)
- `crates/beads-api/src/AGENTS.md` (can be moved from beads-rs/src/api/AGENTS.md)
- `crates/beads-surface/src/AGENTS.md` (new)

**Content pattern** (from existing AGENTS.md files):
- Boundary: what this directory defines
- Depends on: upstream dependencies
- Depended on by: downstream consumers
- NEVER: anti-patterns to avoid
- How to work here: guidelines
- Verification: commands to run
- Dont copy this: things to avoid

**Surface crate AGENTS.md should include**:
- Boundary: IPC protocol types, schemas, client (public surface boundary)
- Depends on: beads-core, beads-api
- Depended on by: beads-rs daemon, external clients
- NEVER: include daemon operational logic, git/WAL/store internals
- Verification: cargo test, cargo check
title: Add AGENTS.md files for new crates
